[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: ProposerElectionType] [HashMap round collision] In RoundProposer's HashMap<Round, AccountAddress>, can round number collisions or wraparound cause incorrect proposer assignments that violate election fairness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: ProposerElectionType] [LeaderReputation gaming] Can validators game the LeaderReputation election by intentionally failing proposals to manipulate their reputation scores and increase selection probability for profitable rounds? [File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Enum: LeaderReputationType] [Version confusion] Can network disagreement on LeaderReputationType (V1 vs V2) cause validators to elect different proposers for the same round, forking the chain? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Struct: ProposerAndVoterConfig] [Weight manipulation] Can malicious governance set active_weight, inactive_weight, or failed_weight to extreme values (0 or u64::MAX) to completely exclude certain validator classes from ever being elected? [File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Struct: ProposerAndVoterConfig] [Weight overflow] If active_weight is u64::MAX and weight_by_voting_power is true, can multiplication with voting power cause integer overflow in weight calculations, corrupting election results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: failure_threshold_percent] [Threshold bypass] Can setting failure_threshold_percent to 0 classify all validators as 'failed', or setting it to 100 ignore all failures, breaking reputation-based election security? (High)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: voter_window_num_validators_multiplier] [Voter tracking bypass] Can voter_window_num_validators_multiplier=0 disable voter reputation tracking, allowing non-participating validators to maintain high reputation unfairly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: weight_by_voting_power] [Centralization risk] If weight_by_voting_power=false, do all validators get equal election probability regardless of stake, enabling Sybil attacks by creating many low-stake validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: decoupled_execution] [Execution coupling attack] Although decoupled_execution() always returns true, does the stored field still affect behavior, and can governance set it to false to create execution/consensus coupling vulnerabilities? [File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: back_pressure_limit] [Deprecated field abuse] Is the deprecated back_pressure_limit field actually unused everywhere, or can it still be exploited by attackers who set extreme values via governance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: exclude_round] [Reputation window manipulation] Can governance set exclude_round to u64::MAX to effectively disable all reputation tracking, or to 0 to include even the most recent incomplete rounds in reputation calculations? [File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: max_failed_authors_to_store] [Memory exhaustion] Can setting max_failed_authors_to_store to usize::MAX cause memory exhaustion as validators store unbounded failed author lists? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/consensus_config.rs] [Field: max_failed_authors_to_store] [Zero value attack] If max_failed_authors_to_store is 0, does consensus stop tracking failures entirely, allowing Byzantine validators to fail repeatedly without reputation impact? (Medium)
